comment: I think he was not very accurate when  addressing the first question,  the question was whether the log-normal distribution was restricting normal distribution only to the positive side. This no.  Because the model was actually about stock returns  ln(ST/st)  this is the log-return of stock price, therefore, return can go negative

Does not the sum of the squares of k standard normal distributions distribute Chi-squared with k degrees of freedom X^2_k?.. if that so its explanation is flawed since it becomes wildly non-constant with k going to infinity: actually its mean is k and its variance is 2k, very different from a Delta distribution (which its what happens with the distribution of the average of standard gaussian distribution). I got lost here near 1/3 of the video.
